meanings.definition: To dub or create a knight
meanings.sent1: The king beknights the brave warrior with a tap on the shoulder.
meanings.sent2: In medieval times, it was a great honor to be beknights by the queen.
meanings.sent3: The young squire accidentally beknights the stable boy with a wooden sword.
meanings.sent4: The magical sword beknights the chosen one with a flash of light.
meanings.sent5: The ceremony to beknights the new knight was filled with pomp and grandeur.

meanings.definition: To honor or recognize someone as a knight
meanings.sent1: The kingdom beknights the loyal servant for his years of service.
meanings.sent2: The queen beknights the brave knight in a lavish ceremony.
meanings.sent3: The jester jokingly beknights the court jester for his comedic skills.
meanings.sent4: The shining armor beknights the knight as a symbol of valor.
meanings.sent5: The royal decree beknights the humble farmer as a knight of the realm.
